1.text: Get your lobster tails out of the freezer 1 day before you want to cook them.

2.text: Arrange the tails on a plate in a single layer and cover them.

3.text: Refrigerate the tails for 24 hours or until they're completely thawed.

4.text: Use kitchen shears to cut through the top shell of each tail.

5.text: Pull open each shell to expose the meat.

6.text: Adjust your oven rack and turn the broiler to "high.

7.text: Mix the garlic powder, smoked paprika, and white pepper in a small bowl.

8.text: Place 2 tails on a sheet and season them with the spices and butter.

10.text: Serve the broiled lobster tails with clarified butter.

11.text: Heat a charcoal or gas grill to medium-high heat.

12.text: Mix the butter, herbs, garlic, hot sauce, and pepper in a bowl.

13.text: Stick a skewer through each of the tails and brush them with olive oil.

14.text: Grill the lobster tails for 9 to 10 minutes.

15.text: Take the tails off of the grill and serve them with the herb butter.

16.text: Bring a large pot of water to a boil and add salt.

17.text: Add 4 tails and boil them for 3 to 10 minutes.

18.text: Heat the butter with lemon juice, parsley, salt, and pepper in a separate pot.

19.text: Use tongs to remove the tails and serve them with the pepper butter.
